questions.question_text: An engineer wants to find all of the objects of a certain type available in the MIB. Which kind of query must be performed?

discussion.content:
First of all question has a typo. There is must be MIT instead MIB.
And the right answer is C
Explanation: Class-level queries return all the objects of a given class. This approach is useful for discovering all the objects of a certain type that are available in the MIT.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/1-x/aci-fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals_chapter_01101.html
This question has multiples and the other responses indicate class-level is the correct answer

choices.B: the DNS A record of the controller hostname

questions.question_text: From which DNS record can a Cisco wireless AP, running Cisco WLC version 6.0 or later, retrieve bootstrap information?

discussion.content: DHCP OPTION 43 for Lightweight Cisco Aironet Access Points
The answer to this should be A. A dhcp option is not a dns record
The answer should be "inline after firewall". If an IPS is on a span port then it cant prevent but only detect

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
The first phase of PPDIOO entails identifying customer requirements. Drag the example on the left to the associated requirement on the right.
Select and Place:
What two addresses are defined under RFC 1918? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: RFC 1918 Address Allocation for Private IP AKA INVALID
